    1. When Free on Board (FOB) is origin, the shipping weight is articulated in terms of a number and a unit of measure. The shipping weight unit of measure is the standard unit that was used to measure the weight of the packaged product. Examples of acceptable units of measure include but are not limited to pounds, grams, and tons.

    9. Enter the Shipping Weight.

  9. Enter the Shipping Package Cube.

    1. The shipping package cube is the size of the shipping package measured in cubic feet. This field is required when the Free on Board (FOB) point value is Origin (O).

    10. Enter the Shipping Package Cube.

  10. Click the Save button to ensure your data is not lost.

    11. Click Save.

page.name: zonal-pricing-tab
page.title: Zonal Pricing Tab
page.body:
This tab corresponds to the information you entered into the Zonal Pricing section of Wizard Management earlier in the process. You must enter information for each zonal area you created previously.

  1. Enter your SIN.

    2. Enter your SIN.

  2. Enter the Manufacturer Part Number.

    1. The Manufacturer Part Number (MPN) is the number created by and assigned to a product by the manufacturer. This field should be entered exactly as provided by the manufacturer, and should not be edited, truncated, or appended in any way.

    3. Enter the Manufacturer Part Number.

  3. Enter the Manufacturer Name.

    1. The Manufacturer Name is the name of the entity that is the original manufacturer of the product. (Examples: Honeywell, Samsung, or DeWalt)

    4. Enter the Manufacturer Name.

  4. Enter the Zonal Offer Price.

    1. This is the price you at which you are offering your product/accessory to customers in a designated zone.

    5. Enter the Zonal Offer Price.

  5. Enter the Zone Number.

    1. This number corresponds to the zonal areas you set up in the Zonal Pricing section as part of Wizard Management.

    6. Enter the Zone Number.

  6. Click the Save button to ensure your data is not lost.

    7. Click Save.

page.name: photos-tab
page.title: Photos Tab
page.body:
Start the interactive lesson below or scroll down for the unabridged step-by-step-instructions.

book Interactive Lesson

presentation/download_photos_lesson

book Instructions

If you answered "Yes" to Photos in the Wizard Management section, you will see this tab added onto your template.

  1. Enter your SIN.

    2. Enter your SIN.

  2. Enter the Manufacturer Part Number.

    1. The Manufacturer Part Number (MPN) is the number created by and assigned to a product by the manufacturer. This field should be entered exactly as provided by the manufacturer, and should not be edited, truncated, or appended in any way.

    3. Enter the Manufacturer Part Number.

  3. Enter the Manufacturer Name.

    1. The Manufacturer Name is the name of the entity that is the original manufacturer of the product. (Examples: Honeywell, Samsung, or DeWalt)

    4. Enter the Manufacturer Name.

  4. Enter the name and file extension exactly as it appears on your computer in the Additional Photo 1 column.

    5. Enter the photo file name and extension.

  5. Repeat Step 4 for any other photos you wish to add. You can add a maximum of three (3) additional photos.

    6. Enter additional photo file names and extensions.

  6. Click the save button to ensure your data is not lost.

    7. Click Save.

page.name: options-tab
page.title: Options Tab
page.body:
If you answered "Yes" to Options in the Wizard Management section, you will see this tab on your template.

  1. Enter your SIN.

    2. Enter your SIN.

  2. Enter the Manufacturer Part Number.

    1. The Manufacturer Part Number (MPN) is the number created by and assigned to a product by the manufacturer. This field should be entered exactly as provided by the manufacturer, and should not be edited, truncated, or appended in any way.

    3. Enter the Manufacturer Part Number.

  3. Enter the Manufacturer Name.

    1. The Manufacturer Name is the name of the entity that is the original manufacturer of the product. (Examples: Honeywell, Samsung, or DeWalt)

    4. Enter the Manufacturer Name.

  4. Enter the Option Part Number.

    1. This is the same as the Manufacturer Part Number, only now, this number will be associated with the option.

    5. Enter the Option Part Number.

  5. Enter the Option Manufacturer.

    6. Enter the Option Manufacturer.

  6. Enter the Option Group.

    1. This is a free text field and will be treated as a title for the options that are included with the product.

    7. Enter the Option Group.

  7. Enter the Option Code.

    1. There are four different choices for the Option Code field:

      • "I" indicates the option is included as a feature of the product

      • "S" indicates the option can be substituted

      • "A" indicates the option can be added

      • "O" indicates none can be selected

    8. Enter the Option Code.

  8. Enter whether the Option is deletable by using "Y" or "N."

    9. Enter if the Option is deletable.

  9. Enter the Option Quantity.

    10. Enter the Option Quanitty.

  10. Enter the Option Unit of Measure.

    1. The Unit of Measure functions in the same way the Unit of Issue does with Products. A list of Units of Issue can be found on the Code Lookup tab.

    11. Enter the Option Unit of Measure.

  11. Enter the Option Price.

    12. Enter the Option Price.

  12. Enter the Option Description.

    13. Enter the Option Description.

  13. Click the Save button to ensure your work is not lost.

    14. Click Save.

page.name: accessories-tab
page.title: Accessories Tab
page.body:
If you answered "Yes" to Accessories in the Wizard Management section, you will see this tab in your template.

  1. Enter your SIN.

    2. Enter your SIN.

  2. Enter the Manufacturer Part Number.

    1. The Manufacturer Part Number (MPN) is the number created by and assigned to a product by the manufacturer. This field should be entered exactly as provided by the manufacturer, and should not be edited, truncated, or appended in any way.

    3. Enter the Manufacturer Part Number.

  3. Enter the Manufacturer Name.

    1. The Manufacturer Name is the name of the entity that is the original manufacturer of the product. (Examples: Honeywell, Samsung, or DeWalt)

    4. Enter the Manufacturer Name.

  4. Enter the Accessory Part Number.

    5. Enter the Accessory Part Number.

  5. Enter the Accessory Manufacturer.

    6. Enter the Accessory Manufacturer.

  6. Click the Save button to ensure your data is not lost.

    7. Click Save.

page.name: uploading-your-template-file-tab
page.title: Uploading Your Template File Tab
page.body:
When you have completed each required field in the downloaded template and saved your work, you are ready to re-upload it into the system.

  1. On the Download/Upload Product Template screen, click on the Choose File button.

    2. Click on the Choose File button.

  2. Navigate to the location where you saved your completed, saved template.

    3. Locate your saved template.

  3. Click the Start Upload button.

    4. Click the Start Upload button.

  4. You will see your file added to a table at the bottom of the screen and the Upload Status will read "In Progress."

    5. Note the Upload Status.

  5. Click the Refresh Status button periodically until your status changes.

    6. Refresh the status.

  6. If your status changes to "Failed:"

    1. Click the link that reads Click HERE for Errors to download an Excel document that contains your errors.

      2. Open the document to view your errors.

    2. An Excel document will open that contains all of the information you previously entered, along with a Validation Messages field for any tab that contains errors.

      3. View your errors.

    3. After you edit your content to address all reported errors, save your document.

    4. Delete the previous document from the system.

      5. Delete the previous document from the system.

    5. Click Yes on the Confirm Delete message.

      6. Click Yes.

    6. Repeat steps 1-5.

  7. If your status changes to "Complete:"

    1. Your document does not contain any errors and you can move onto the next step.

      2. When the Upload Status reads "Complete," your document contains no errors.

page.name: on-screen-data-entry-overview
page.title: On-Screen Data Entry Overview
page.body:
This method will allow you to enter the product details on the screen online. You can copy and paste your product details on the grid provided on the screen. You will be required to click the Save Products button after completing each step.

This method works best when you have fewer than 100 products and are online while entering the product details.

  1. Click the Proceed to Enter On Screen button on the Product Template Method main screen.

    2. Click the Proceed to Enter On Screen button.

  2. Choose a SIN from the drop-down menu. The SINs that were added in the offer will be listed here.

    3. Choose your SIN from the drop-down menu.

  3. The on-screen data grid has been customized based upon the selections made within the Wizard Template. The sections that were answered as "Yes" within the Wizard Template will now appear as tabs on the screen.

    4. A look at the on-screen data grid.

page.name: get-started-tab
page.title: Get Started Tab
page.body:
Start the interactive lesson below or scroll down for the unabridged step-by-step-instructions.

book Interactive Lesson

presentation/get_started_tab_lesson

book Instructions

In this section, you will enter your Manufacturer Part Number and Name for each product included under the selected SIN. You will be able to add multiple products/accessories in this section, but only one per row.

This information will be transferred to other tabs in this section.

  1. Select your SIN from the drop-down menu.

    2. Select your SIN.

  2. Click the Select button.

    3. Click the Select button.

  3. Enter the Manufacturer Part Number.

    • The Manufacturer Part Number (MPN) is the number created by and assigned to a product by the manufacturer. This field should be entered exactly as provided by the manufacturer, and should not be edited, truncated, or appended in any way.

      • Enter the Manufacturer Part Number.

  4. Enter the Manufacturer Name.

    • The Manufacturer Name is the name of the original manufacturer of the product and is a maximum of 40 characters.

    Enter the Manufacturer Name.

  5. Select the Product/Accessory Type from the drop-down menu.

    6. Select the Product/Accessory Type.

  6. Click the Save Products button after completing each row. If you do not save your work frequently, you will lose your information if you navigate away from this page or your session times out.

    7. Screenshot of the Save Products button.

  7. Click OK on the Product Confirmation pop-up window.

    8. Click OK.

  8. Repeat steps 3-7 to add other products/accessories under this SIN

page.name: pricing-tab
page.title: Pricing Tab
page.body:
Start the interactive lesson below or scroll down for the unabridged step-by-step-instructions.

book Interactive Lesson

presentation/pricing_tab_lesson

book Instructions

On this tab, you will enter your general pricing information along with descriptions of your item(s). You must complete each required field as marked with an asterisk (*). Remember to save your work frequently to avoid losing your data.

  1. You will notice that the Manufacturer Part Number, Manufacturer Name, and Product/Accessory Type have been auto-populated from your responses on the Get Started tab. Ensure each field is correct before moving on.

    2. Note the auto-populated information.

  2. Enter the Product/Accessory Name. Be sure to use the name that the manufacturer has given to the product.

    3. Enter the Product/Accessory Name.

  3. If applicable, enter the UPC into the text box.

    • A Universal Product Code (UPC) is a unique identification code that is assigned to a product by a governing organization. UPCs can take several formats, ranging from 8 to 14 digits. Most products submitted for sale on a Federal Supply Schedule will follow the UPC-A 12 character format.

    Enter the UPC.

  4. Enter the Vendor's Product/Accessory Description.

    • The vendor's product or accessory description is the description as created or provided by the seller. This description may be different than the description provided by the manufacturer.

    Enter the Vendor's Product/Accessory Description.

  5. Select the Unit of Issue using the drop-down menu. Use the scroll bar to search for the appropriate selection.

    • The Unit of Issue describes in what format, quantity, or packaging a product will be sold. The most common unit of issue is "each," but other examples include, but are not limited to: "box," "pack," or "dozen."

    Select the Unit of Issue.

  6. Enter the Quantity Per Unit.

    • An example of this field would be for a product like a laptop, which is usually sold individually, the unit of issue would most likely be "each" and the quantity per unit would be "1." However, with products like markers that are sold more than one in a package, the unit of issue would be "package" and the quantity per unit would be the number of markers in the package.

    Enter the Quantity Per Unit.

  7. If applicable, select the Quantity of Product/Unit.

    • To continue the example above, with a product such as a laptop, which is usually sold individually, the Unit of Issue would most likely be "each" and the quantity per unit would be "1." However, with products like markers that are sold more than one in a package, the unit of issue would be "package" and the quantity per unit would be the number of markers in the package.

    Select the Quantity of Product/Unit.

  8. If applicable, enter the Vendor Part Number.

    • The Vendor Part Number is an optional field used to identify a company-specific part number. This term is also known as the contractor's part number.

    Enter the Vendor Part Number.

  9. Enter the Commercial List Price.

    • Enter the price at which you offer your item commercially into the Commercial List Price text box using numbers only, with a maximum of 17 digits before the decimal and 4 digits after the decimal (e.g. $45,000.00).

    Enter the Commercial List Price.

  10. Enter the Best Priced Customer.

    • This indicates the customer or category of customers (commercial or government entity) to which your company offers the absolute best price, independent of terms, conditions, discounts, and/or concessions.

    Enter the Best Priced Customer.

  11. Enter the Price Offered to the Best Priced Customer.

    12. Enter the Price Offered to the Best Priced Customer.

  12. Enter the Discount Offered to the Best Priced Customer.

    • You will need to calculate the discount between the Commercial List Price and the Price Offered to Best Priced Customer using a percentage.

    Enter the Discount Offered to the Best Priced Customer.

  13. If applicable, select the Manufacturer Warranty - Warranty Period from the drop-down menu.

    14. Select the Manufacturer Warranty - Warranty Period.

  14. If applicable, enter the number of warranty periods.

    • If you selected "Lifetime" as the Warranty Period, enter "0" in this field.

    Enter the Number of Warranty Periods.

  15. If applicable, enter the Manufacturer Warranty - Description.

    16. Enter the Manufacturer Warranty - Description.

  16. Select the Production Point from the drop-down menu.

    • The Production Point is the country in which the product is manufactured.

    Select the Production Point.

  17. If applicable, select the Production Point 2 from the drop-down menu.

    18. Select the Production Point 2.

  18. If applicable, enter the Delivery (Lead) Time Days.

    • The number of days it will take for the product to meet the established delivery (lead) time code. This field is for defining the numerical value only. For example, if you plan to select "AE" for your Delivery (Lead) Time Code and enter "5" into the Delivery (Lead) Time Days field, then the expectation is that the product will ship (leave your company) 5 days after you receive the order.

    Enter the Delivery (Lead) Time Days.

  19. Select the Delivery (Lead) Time Code.

    • Use this field to identify the method in which your company determines delivery lead time.

    • Using the drop-down menu, select the code that applies to your item.

    Select the Delivery (Lead) Time Code.

  20. If applicable, enter the Federal Supply Code/Product Supply Code (FSC/PSC), the United Nations Standard Products and Services Code (UNSPSC), and the National Stock Number (NSN).

    21. Enter the FSC/PSC, UNSPSC, and NSN fields.

  21. Click the Save Pricing button.

    • You MUST click the Save Pricing button before completing another row or moving onto another tab. If you do not click this button, all of your data will be lost.

    Save your work.

  22. Click OK on the Product Confirmation pop-up message.

    23. Click OK.

Click OK.

  4. Select your unit for pricing. You will notice there are a number of choices from which to choose.

page.title: Delivery Tab
page.body:
This section is required and was automatically selected for you in the Wizard Management section.

  1. Some of the data you entered in previous tabs has been auto-populated into this tab. Double check that this information is correct before moving on.

    2. Note the auto-populated information.

  2. Make your delivery selection for CONUS (contiguous United States) from the drop-down menu.

    3. Make your delivery selection for CONUS.

    FOB stands for Free on Board. You will have two FOB delivery from which to choose: FOB Origin indicates shipping is paid by the seller, FOB Destination indicates shipping is paid by the buyer, and FOB No Delivery means the seller does not offer delivery to that state.

  3. Make your delivery selections for the remaining fields.

    4. Make selections for the remaining fields.

  4. Enter the Shipping Unit Weight.

    • The Shipping Unit Weight is the numerical measurement of the weight of the packaged product.

    Enter the Shipping Unit Weight.

  5. Enter the Shipping Package Cube.

    • The Shipping Package Cube is the size of the shipping package measured in cubic feet. This field is required when the Free on Board (FOB) point value is Origin (O).

    Enter the Shipping Package Cube.

  6. Click the Save Delivery button.

    7. Click Save Delivery.

  7. Click OK on the Product Confirmation pop-up message.

    8. Click OK.

page.name: dimensions-and-shipping-tab
page.title: Dimensions & Shipping Tab
page.body:
In this section, you will enter your product's specifications such as color, length, height, and width, among others.

  1. Note the auto-populated information. Ensure the information is correct before moving on.

    2. Note the auto-populated information.

  2. If applicable, enter the Default Color.

    3. Enter the Default Color.

  3. If applicable, enter the Product Length - Unit Number.

    1. The product length unit number is the numerical measurement of a product as measured from side to side. This field is for defining the numerical value only. The unit of measure will be defined in a separate field.

    4. Enter the Product Length - Unit Number.

  4. If applicable, enter the Product Length - Unit of Measure.

    1. The product length unit of measure is the standard unit that was used to measure the number of units. Examples of units of measure are: "feet," "inches," or "meters."

    5. Enter the Product Length - Unit Measure.

  5. If applicable, enter the Product Width – Unit Number.

    1. The product width unit number is the numerical measurement of a product as measured from side to side. This field is for defining the numerical value only. The unit of measure will be defined in a separate field.

    6. Enter the Product Width - Unit Number.

  6. If applicable, enter the Product Width – Unit of Measure.

    1. The product width unit of measure is the standard unit that was used to measure the number of units. Examples of units of measure are: "feet," "inches," or "meters."

    7. Enter the Product Width - Unit of Measure

  7. If applicable, enter the Product Height – Unit Number.

    1. The product height unit number is the numerical measurement of a product as measured from side to side. This field is for defining the numerical value only.

    8. Enter the Product Height – Unit Number.

  8. If applicable, enter the Product Height – Unit of Measure.

    1. The Product Height – Unit of Measure is the standard unit that was used to measure the number of units. Examples of units of measure are: "feet", "inches", or "meters".

    9. Enter the Product Height – Unit of Measure.

  9. If applicable, enter the Product Specific Web Site.

    1. The product specific website is used to provide a URL for a page with data specific to this product. For example, if you maintain your own online catalog, you may opt to provide a link to this page.

    10. Enter the Product Specific Web Site.

  10. If applicable, enter the Standard Package Size.

    1. The standard package size is the unit of measure you consistently sell items in packages of a specific size and type. This field is optional. Standard packs always consist of multiple quantities of the same item. Standard packs do not contain multiple items. For example: 12.

    11. Enter the Standard Package Size.

  11. Click the Save Dimensions & Shipping button.

    12. Click Save Dimensions & Shipping.

  12. Click OK on the Product Confirmation pop-up message.

    13. Click OK.

page.name: upload-additional-photos

page.body:
After you have entered the file names of any additional photos into your template, you are now ready to upload the actual photo files. You must ensure the photo file(s) you upload have the exact same name as the ones you entered earlier.

  1. On the Capture and Generate Pricing main screen, locate STEP 1B at the bottom-left of your screen.

    2. Locate STEP 1B.

  2. Click on the Upload Additional Photos button.
