page.title: Cancellation/Terminations Modifications
page.body:
video
video_library_page/example_library/emod/cancel-contract-modficiations/https:%2F%2Fs3.amazonaws.com%2Felucid-demo-videos%2Femod_cancel_contract.mp4

The Cancellation modification enables you to cancel an existing contract for reasons determined by your business.

  1. First, log into the eMod system and select your contract. (For more information, read the Getting Started with eMod Section.)

  2. Select Cancel Contract from the list of modification subtypes and click Submit Online.

    3. Caution: It may seem obvious though still bears mentioning, the Cancel Contract mod type cannot be combined with any other mods.

    Select the Cancel Contract subtype and click Submit Online

  3. Verify your corporate information, click Save and Continue.

    4. Verify your Corporate Information and click Save and Continue

  4. Click Continue on the Information Saved screen.

    5. Click Continue on the Information Saved screen

  5. Click the textbox and provide the CO with information as to why you are canceling your contract.

    6. Provide the CO with information as to why you are canceling your contract

  6. On the information saved message click Continue.

    7. Click Continue on the Information Saved screen

  7. You will then be required to upload documents in support of this modification. Afterwards, you will have a chance for a final review of your eMod. (For more information read Uploading Documents & Submitting Your eMod.

    8. Upload and Submit your modification

  8. When you are finished you will see a success message.

    9. Your mod has been submitted successfully

  9. You will notice your modification under the Submitted Modifications section on the My Modifications screen. For any information about the processes after submitting your eMod read the Post-Submission of an eMod section.

  10. To rescind the "Cancel Contract"; click the Rescind Mod button and confirm the action. The mod will be rescinded

Caution: Canceling your contract is an important decision that can only be undone during the thirty day window between submitting the cancellation request and the time that it goes into effect. After this thirty day period, you will need to go through the contract offer process all over again. With this in mind, think carefully as to whether or not you really want to cancel your contract.

You can rescind your Cancel Contract modification up to 30 days after submitting the modification.

page.name: deletion-modifications-overview
page.title: Deletion Modifications Overview
page.body:
Removing details from your company profile that are no longer relevant keeps parties both inside and outside of your organization well-versed in current labor categories and/or service offerings, products and SINs.

Key Concept: Deletion modifications fall under the category known as "Rapid Action Modifications". This means that a contractor can submit a Deletion Modification request and the Contracting Officer can approve it without having to go through the signature process.

These are the Deletion modifications.

page.name: delete-labor-category-or-service-offerings
page.title: Delete Labor Category/or Service Offerings
page.body:
video
video_library_page/example_library/emod/deletions-modifications/https:%2F%2Fs3.amazonaws.com%2Felucid-demo-videos%2Femod_delete_labor_service.mp4

Removing labor categories and service offerings is a natural part of a business maturing. The business community should always be aware of current services.

Key Concept: Deletion modifications fall under the category known as "Rapid Action Modifications". This means that a contractor can submit a Deletion Modification request and the Contracting Officer can approve it without having to go through the signature process.

  1. First, log into the eMod system and select your contract. (For more information, read the Getting Started with eMod Section.)

  2. Select Delete Labor Category and/or Service Offerings from the list of modification subtypes and click Submit Online.

    3. Select the Delete Labor Category and/or Service Offerings subtype and click Submit Online

  3. Verify your corporate information, click Save and Continue.

    4. Verify your Corporate Information and click Save and Continue

  4. Click Continue on the Information Saved screen.

    5. Click Continue on the Information Saved screen

  5. Enter any details regarding the deletion of the labor category and or service offerings in the box for a Modification Request. You should identify the labor category and/or service offering you wish to remove from your schedule and provide some information as to why that labor category is no longer relevant to the services you provide. Click Save and Continue.

    6. Enter a detailed description of your deletion and click Save and Continue

  6. On the information saved message click Continue.

    7. Click Continue on the Information Saved screen

  7. You will then be required to upload documents in support of this modification. Afterwards, you will have a chance for a final review of your eMod. (For more information read Uploading Documents & Submitting Your eMod.

    8. Upload and Submit your modification

  8. When you are finished you will see a success message.

    9. Your mod has been submitted successfully.

  9. You will notice your modification under the Submitted Modifications section on the My Modifications screen. For any information about the processes after submitting your eMod read the Post-Submission of an eMod section.

    10. Caution: Once the termination is in effect, you will no longer be able to provide products or services falling under that SIN category. Note that the system will not allow you to terminate all of the SINs associated with a particular contract as doing so would eliminate your company's ability to provide products or services to the government. If this is your goal, you should instead submit a Cancel Contract modification.

page.name: delete-product-s
page.title: Delete Product(s)
page.body:
video
video_library_page/example_library/emod/deletions-modifications/https:%2F%2Fs3.amazonaws.com%2Felucid-demo-videos%2Femod_delete_product.mp4

Eliminating product offerings is a necessary business function, as it allows for new items to be made available to customers.

Step 1
Initial Steps

Key Concept: Deletion modifications fall under the category known as "Rapid Action Modifications". This means that a contractor can submit a Deletion Modification request and the Contracting Officer can approve it without having to go through the signature process.

  1. First, log into the eMod system and select your contract. (For more information, read the Getting Started with eMod Section.)

  2. Select Delete Products from the list of modification subtypes and click Submit Online.

    3. Select the Delete Product(s) subtype and click 'Submit Online.'

  3. Verify your corporate information, click Save and Continue.

    4. Verify your Corporate Information and click 'Save and Continue.'

  4. Click Continue on the Information Saved screen.

    5. Click 'Continue' on the Information Saved screen.

  5. Select the SIN(s) you wish to modify and click on the right-facing arrow.

    6. Select your SIN(s).

  6. You will see your SIN(s) listed in the Selected SIN(s) box.

    7. Your SIN(s) will appear in the box to the right.

  7. Enter a detailed description of the products you wish to delete in the provided text box.

    8. Enter your description.

  8. When you are finished, click Save and Continue.

    9. Save your work.

  9. On the Information Saved message, click Continue.

    10. Click Continue.

  10. Click on the Capture Pricing section in the left hand navigational menu.

    11. Go to the Capture Pricing section.

  11. If you select the Download/Upload Template process, follow the steps below or proceed to the On-Screen Data Entry Process.

Step 2.A
Download/Upload Template Process

Download/Upload Template Process

  1. On the Product Template screen, click the Download button.

    2. Click the Download button.

  2. On the Pricing Data spreadsheet, enter the SIN into the cell.

    3. Enter the SIN.

  3. Next, enter the Manufacturer Part Number.

    4. Enter the Manufacturer Part Number.

  4. Enter the Manufacturer Name.

    5. Enter the Manufacturer Name.

  5. Click the Save button.

    6. Save your work.

  6. Back on the Product Template screen, click on the Choose File button.

    7. Click the Choose File button.

  7. Navigate to your saved template and click the Start Upload button.

    8. Upload your file.

  8. You will see your file added to a table at the bottom of the screen.

    9. Your file will appear below.

  9. The Upload Status will first display as "In Progress."

    10. "In Progress" Upload Status.

  10. Click the Refresh Status button until the status changes.

    11. Click the Refresh Status button.

    1. If the status displays as "Failed:"

      1. Click the provided link to open the spreadsheet containing your errors.

        2. Click the link to correct your errors.

      2. Correct the listed errors and save your document.

      3. Click the Delete File button to remove the previous document from the system.

        4. Delete the current file.

      4. Click Yes on the Confirm Delete screen.

        5. Click Yes.

      5. Repeat steps 8-11.

    2. When your status displays as "Complete:"

      1. Click the Go To Capture Pricing button at the bottom of the screen.

      2. Follow the Generate Pricing Document process.

Step 2.B
On-Screen Data Entry Process

On-Screen Data Entry Process

  1. On the Delete Product Modification screen, enter the Manufacturer Name.

    2. Enter the Manufacturer Name.

  2. Enter the Manufacturer Part Number.

    3. Enter the Manufacturer Part Number.

  3. Click the Search button.

    4. Click Search.

  4. The rest of the product information will be auto-populated in the remaining fields.

    5. The information will be auto-populated.

  5. Click the Add Product For Delete Modification button.

    6. Click Add Product For Delete Modification.

  6. You will see the product information added to a table at the bottom of the screen.

    7. Your information will be added to the table.

  7. Click on the Go To Capture Pricing button.

    8. Click "Go To Capture Pricing".

  8. Follow the Generate Pricing Document process.

Step 3
Generate Pricing Document
book_page_page/modules%2Fbook%2Fdatabase.xml/eoffer_emod/eoffer-resources/preparing-your-electronic-contract-offer-eoffer/generate-pricing-document
Step 4
Upload Documents and Submit Request

You will then be required to upload documents in support of this modification. Afterwards, you will have a chance for a final review of your eMod. (For more information read Uploading Documents & Submitting Your eMod).

  1. When you are finished, you will see a success message.

    2. Your mod has been submitted successfully.

    Caution: Once the termination is in effect, you will no longer be able to provide products or services falling under that SIN category. Note that the system will not allow you to terminate all of the SINs associated with a particular contract as doing so would eliminate your company's ability to provide products or services to the government. If this is your goal, you should instead submit a Cancel Contract modification.

page.name: legal-modifications-overview
page.title: Legal Modifications Overview
page.body:
There are two types of Legal Modifications: Change of Name Agreement and Novation Agreement. Both are critical, as they deal with the direction of an organization's mission and its services and the accurate execution of a variety of business transactions. These can range from the exchange of basic information to the resolution of debts and other financial obligations.

These are the Legal Modifications.

page.name: change-of-name-agreement-modification
page.title: Change of Name Agreement Modification
page.body:
An entity choosing to change its name is a major step, as it is a reflection of a company's direction and the services it provides. There are many issues that must be addressed when an organization undertakes changing its name.

Please read the on-screen instructions very carefully.

  1. First, log into the eMod system and select your contract. (For more information, read the Getting Started with eMod Section.)

  2. Select Change of Name Agreement from the list of modification subtypes and click Submit Online.

    3. Select the Change of Name Agreement subtype and click 'Submit Online.'

  3. Verify your corporate information, click Save and Continue.

    4. Verify your Corporate Information and click 'Save and Continue.'

  4. Click Continue on the Information Saved screen.

    5. Click 'Continue' on the Information Saved screen.

  5. Changing your name may impact your DUNS. To begin with you will be asked if you would like the replace the existing DUNS on this contract. For the purpose of this demonstration we are going to respond Yes, and take you through the process.

To access SAM, go to www.sam.gov, or look for the SAM link under the "Before You Begin" section on the eOffer/eMod homepage. After the corrections are made, the eOffer/eMod system will update in approximately 24 hours.

    Verify your Corporate Information.

  8. On the next screen enter the description for "Change of Name Agreement". Enter any details in the box for a Modification Request. The default is N/A. You will be asked later to upload documentation supporting this agreement, but it helps to provide some brief background information here.

    9. Key Concept: The bulk of information that must accompany such a modification is provided via the uploaded documents section. To begin, you will need to provide your CO with three signed copies of the Change of Name Agreement. Additional documents will include: documentation authenticated by a State official; an opinion by your company's legal counsel; and a list of all affected contracts and purchase orders.

    Enter a detailed description of your Change of Name modification.

    12. Your mod has been submitted successfully.

  12. You will notice your modification under the Submitted Modifications section on the My Modifications screen. For any information about the processes after submitting your eMod, read the Post-Submission of an eMod section.

page.name: novation-agreement-modification
page.title: Novation Agreement Modification
page.body:
Novation Agreement Modifications are used when a new debtor corporation agrees to pay the debts of an old debtor corporation. These are very important modifications and, if you have any question about the mod's applicability to you, you should contact your Contracting Officer.

  1. First, log into the eMod system and select your contract. (For more information, read the Getting Started with eMod Section.)

  2. Select Novation from the list of modification subtypes and click Submit Online.

    3. Select the Novation subtype and click 'Submit Online.'

  3. Verify your corporate information and click Save and Continue.

    4. Verify your Corporate Information and click 'Save and Continue.'

  4. Click Continue on the Information Saved screen.

    5. Click 'Continue' on the Information Saved screen.

  5. A Novation agreement might mean that you will need to replace your existing DUNs with a new one. To begin with you will be asked if you would like the replace the existing DUNS on this contract. For the purpose of this demonstration we are going to respond Yes, and take you through the process.

    6. Input whether you need to replace the existing DUNS.

  6. Enter the new DUNS and, if applicable, the Plus 4 number.

    7. Enter the replacement DUNS.

  7. Next, answer the Novation question and each of the subsequent questions. Your answers will determine what documents are required to upload and submit the Mod. The questions all focus on whether or not you have other outstanding contracts with GSA or other Federal agencies that require novation. The goal is to provide the CO with enough information to determine where you are in the novation process.

    8. Enter a detailed description of the novation.

  8. Here is an example of one particular scenario. When you are finished click Save and Continue.

    9. Here is an example of one particular scenario.

  9. You will be asked to confirm that the information appearing with your new DUNS number is correct. Review the information to ensure it is correct and click Save and Continue.

    10. Caution: If any information on the Corporate Information screen is not correct, you will need to make corrections in SAM. To access SAM, go to www.sam.gov, or look for the SAM link under the "Before You Begin" section on the eOffer/eMod homepage. After the corrections are made, the eOffer/eMod system will update in approximately 24 hours.

    Verify the new Corporate Information.

  10. The Description for Novation Agreement page will appear as shown below. Begin by noting the documents that will be required during the Upload Documents process. These can be found next to Instructions. The description is optional. The default value is "N/A." Entering a brief description, however, will help the Contracting Officer. Click Save and Continue.

    11. Enter a description for the Novation Agreement

  11. On the information saved message click Continue.

    12. Click Continue on the Information Saved screen

  12. You will then be required to upload documents in support of this modification. Afterwards, you will have a chance for a final review of your eMod. (For more information read Uploading Documents & Submitting Your eMod.

    13. Upload and Submit your modification

  13. When you are finished you will see a success message.

    14. Your mod has been submitted successfully

  14. You will notice your modification under the Submitted Modifications section on the My Modifications screen. For any information about the processes after submitting your eMod read the Post-Submission of an eMod section.

page.name: pricing-modifications-overview
page.title: Pricing Modifications Overview
page.body:
Pricing modifications allow organizations to accurately document increases and decreases in the prices of their products of services. Whether influenced by the economic climate or changes in production, accurate prices are critical to the procurement of a various services.

These are the Pricing Modifications

The following rules apply to the pricing modifications:

  • Both Temporary Price and Permanent Price Reduction cannot be selected at the same time.

  • If Permanent Price Reduction is selected the vendor must select either (A) Permanent price reduction (based on most favored customer) or (B) Permanent Price Reduction (industry partner requested).

  • Similarly both Economic Price Adjustments cannot be selected at the same time. The vendor must select either (A) Economic Price Adjustments (EPA) with commercial price list (increase) or (B) Economic Price Adjustments (EPA) without commercial price list (increase).

If any of the above-mentioned rules are violated the following error message will be displayed.

Pricing modification selection error

page.body:

page.name: economic-price-adjustments-epa-with-commercial-price-list-increase
page.title: Economic Price Adjustments (EPA) with Commercial Price List (increase)
page.body:
A company must adjust prices when the country's economic climate changes.

  1. First, log into the eMod system and select your contract. (For more information, read the Getting Started with eMod Section.)

  2. Select Economic Price Adjustments (EPA) with Commercial Price List (increase) from the list of modification subtypes and click Submit Online.

    3. Select the Economic Price Adjustments (EPA) with Commercial Price List (increase) subtype and click Submit Online

  3. Verify your corporate information, click Save and Continue.

    4. Verify your Corporate Information and click Save and Continue

  4. Click Continue on the Information Saved screen.

    5. Click Continue on the Information Saved screen

  5. Determine if your Commercial Sales Practice (CSP) need to be updated as part of the pricing modification submission. If you need to revise your CSP select Yes then Save. You will be taken to your Commercial Sales Practice. For instructions on revising your CSP, please refer to the Update/Revise Commercial Sales Practice section.) If you do not need to revise your CSP, click No then Save and continue to the next step.

    6. Determine if you need to update your Commercial Sales Practice

  6. Enter percentage increase you are requesting for this adjustment modification.

    7. Enter the percentage increase of your adjustment

  7. In the textbox, provide the CO with enough information justifying your price increase. Note that this adjustment should be pursuant to the agreed-upon terms of your schedule contract. When you are finished click Save and Continue.

    8. Key Concept: GSA allows vendors to increase their schedule prices in accordance with economic price adjustments. The pricing index to be used, whether it is the CPI, inflation, or another agreed-upon index, is typically determined prior to contract award.

    Enter a detailed description of your Economic Price Adjustments (EPA) with Commercial Price List (increase)

  8. On the information saved message click Continue.

    9. Click Continue on the Information Saved screen

  9. You will then be required to upload documents in support of this modification. Afterwards, you will have a chance for a final review of your eMod. (For more information read Uploading Documents & Submitting Your eMod.

    10. Upload and Submit your modification

  10. When you are finished you will see a success message.

    11. Your mod has been submitted successfully

  11. You will notice your modification under the Submitted Modifications section on the My Modifications screen. For any information about the processes after submitting your eMod read the Post-Submission of an eMod section.

page.name: capture-formatted-pricing
page.title: Capture Formatted Pricing
page.body:
The Capture Formatted Pricing modification allows you to enter your pricing information into the system using the Formatted Product Tool process. This mod will capture data related to your zonal pricing, special charges, photos, and more.

Step 1
Initial Steps

Initial Steps

Start the interactive lesson below or scroll down for the unabridged step-by-step-instructions.

book Initial Steps Interactive Lesson

presentation/cfp_initial

book Initial Steps Instructions

  1. First, log into the eMod system and select your contract. (For more information, read the Getting Started with eMod Section.)

  2. Select Capture Formatted Pricing from the list of modification subtypes and click Submit Online.

    3. Select the Capture Formatted Pricing mod.

  3. Verify your corporate information, click Save and Continue.

    4. Click Save and Continue.

  4. Click Continue on the Information Saved screen.

    5. Click Continue.

  5. You will see a table containing all of your SINs and their corresponding descriptions.

    6. Your SIN(s) will be displayed in a table.

  6. Enter a detailed description of your modification request in the provided text box.

    7. Enter your description.

  7. Select your Offer Category by clicking on the appropriate radio button.

    8. Select your offer category.

  8. Click Save and Continue.

    9. Click Save and Continue.

  9. On the Information Saved screen, click Continue.

    10. Click Continue.

  10. On the Point of Contact Information screen, click the Add Point of Contact Details button.

    11. Click Add Point of Contact Details.

  11. Enter your point of contact’s information.

    12. Enter the contact information.

  12. When you have filled out all required information, click the Add Point of Contact Information button.

    13. Click Add Point of Contact Information.

Step 2
Wizard Management

Wizard Management

Start the interactive lesson below or scroll down for the unabridged step-by-step-instructions.

Wizard Management Interactive Lesson

presentation/cfp_wizard

Wizard Management Instructions

Wizard Management allows you to customize the fields that will appear on your template. This section includes methods for entering details for product-related line ­items, uploading additional photos, generating an offer analysis report, and generating pricing documents. This section will appear only when you choose Products Only or Products and Services within the offer category.

Wizard Management constitutes the following components: Discounts, Delivery, Contractor Warranty, Zonal Pricing, Special Charges, Special Features, Accessories, Options, and Photos.

Select the categories that apply to your offer.

Helpful Hint: Selections made on this screen will be visible on the left-hand menu and as tabs in the Capture Pricing table, and will affect subsequent steps in the offer process. If you select Accessories or Options, these sections will not be visible on the left panel, however, they will be captured within your final template.

  1. Using the drop-down menus, select Yes for the categories that apply to your offer. Delivery will automatically be selected for you as it is a mandatory field. Categories include: Discounts, Delivery, Contractor Warranty, Zonal Pricing, Special Charges, Special Features, Accessories, Options, and Photos.

    Select the categories that apply to your offer.

  2. For the Discounts and Delivery categories, you must also select the level (Offer Level, SIN Level, or Line Item Level) at which they will be applied.

    3. Select the level for your and Discount and Delivery categories.

  3. Click the Save Wizard Responses button before you click Save and Continue. If you do not click this button first, your data will be lost.

    4. Helpful Hint: You must click Save Wizard Responses before clicking Save and Continue or your entires will be lost.

    Click Save Wizard Responses BEFORE you hit Save and Continue.

  4. Click the Save and Continue button.

    5. Click Save and Continue second.

  5. Your left-hand navigational menu will change based on the selections you made in this section. Based on your personal selections, your screen may look different than what is presented below.

Your left-hand navigation will reflect your Wizard Management selections.

Step 3
Zonal Pricing

Zonal Pricing

If you selected "Yes" to Zonal Pricing on the Wizard Management screen, you are required to fill out this section. The Zonal Pricing section allows you to define your pricing based on zones you define.

The Zonal Pricing screen allows you to define your pricing based on zones that you define.

  1. First, select a zone number between 01-10 using the Enter Zone Number drop-down menu.

    2. Select your first Zone number.

  2. Select the zonal area. "CONUS" indicates the contiguous United States.

    1. Each state in CONUS will automatically be checked. Uncheck any box(es) next to the state(s) that do not apply to the zonal area you are creating.

    3. CONUS is the contiguous United States.

  3. Click the Add Zone button.

    4. Click the Add Zone button.

  4. You will see your zone added to the List of Zones table.

    5. The zone you just defined will appear in the List of Zones table below.

  5. "NON-CONUS" indicates non-contiguous US states and territories. To add these territories, select a zone area that is different from the one(s) you have already created and click the radio button next to NON-CONUS.

    6. NON-CONUS indicates non-contiguous US states and territories.

  6. Repeat steps 3 and 4.

  7. Ensure that each state, both CONUS and NON-CONUS, is represented by a zonal area.

    8. Ensure all states and territories are accounted for by your zones.

  8. When you have entered all of your zones, click the Save and Continue button.

    9. When you are finished, click Save and Continue.

Step 4
Special Charges

Step 13
Upload Documents and Submit Request

Upload Documents and Submit Request

  1. On the Upload Documents screen, you will be able to attach supporting documentation for your eMod.

  2. Click on the Upload link under the Action column for each type.

    1. Note: You are required to upload documents for every type marked with an asterisk. If you have additional documents that are not required, you can upload them on this screen under the corresponding Type column.

      Click on the 'Upload' link to add your supporting documentation.

  3. Click Save and Continue.

  4. On the Information Saved screen, click Continue.

  5. Once all of your documentation has been uploaded, click Save and Continue.

  6. If you are ready to submit your mod, click Yes on the Confirmation screen.

page.name: create-manage-discounts
page.title: Create/Manage Discounts
page.body:
With this mod, you can create a new discount under your SIN or manage an existing discount. You can also change the level at which your discount is offered.

Step 1
Initial Steps

Initial Steps

  1. First, log into the eMod system and select your contract. (For more information, read the Getting Started with eMod Section.)

  2. Select Create/Manage Discounts from the list of modification subtypes and click Submit Online.

  3. Verify your corporate information, click Save and Continue.

    4. Click Save and Continue.

  4. Click Continue on the Information Saved screen.

    5. Click Continue.

  5. Enter a detailed description of your discounts modification. You may also include a reason for the change in discount.

    6. Enter your description.

  6. Click the Save and Continue button.

    7. Click Save and Continue.

  7. Click Continue on the Information Saved screen.

    8. Click Continue.

  8. If you wish to no longer offer a discount under this SIN:

    1. Select No from the Discounts drop-down menu.

      2. Select No.

    2. Click the Save Wizard Responses button.

    3. Click Yes on the Confirm Wizard Response screen.

      4. Click Yes.

    4. Click the Save and Continue button.

    5. Click Continue on the Information Saved screen.

      6. Click Continue.

    6. Proceed to Step 10.

  9. If you wish to change the level at which your discount is offered:

    1. Click the radio button for the level at which your discount will be offered.

    2. Click the Save Wizard Responses button.

      3. Click Save Wizard Responses.

    3. Click the Save and Continue button.

      4. Click Save and Continue.

    4. Click Continue on the Information Saved screen.

      5. Click Continue.

      Helpful Hint: You will need to enter information for each SIN in the drop-down menu, but you can only do so for one SIN at a time.

    5. On the Discounts screen, select your SIN.

      6. Select your SIN.

    6. Enter the Start Range with a number greater than 1.

      7. Enter your Start Range.

    7. Enter the End Range with a number greater than the number entered for the Start Range.

      8. Enter the End Range.

    8. Enter a percentage value for the established range in the Discount %text box.

      9. Enter the Discount.

    9. Enter any conditions that may be applicable to your discount.

      10. Enter your conditions.

    10. Click the Add Discount button.

      11. Click Add Discount.

      12. The Discount Listing table.

    13. Click the Save and Continue button.

      14. Click Save and Continue.

  5. Click the Save and Continue button.

page.name: technical-modifications-overview
page.title: Technical Modifications Overview
page.body:
Technical modifications concentrate on details that accurately describe or catalog your products or services. Whether making changes to the numbering system that identifies a product or service or the particular functions of those offerings, undertaking technical modifications is a critical part of the contracting lifecycle.

This image shows the Technical Modification Types

page.name: terms-and-conditions-modifications-overview
page.title: Terms and Conditions Modifications Overview
page.body:
The nine Terms and Conditions modifications manage a variety of operational concerns that organizations have, ranging from the eligibility of employees with regarding citizenship to participation in certain government-directed programs. These mods relate to those provisions that govern your MAS contract.

These are the Terms and Conditions modifications.

Caution: The "Re-representation of Non-Novated Merger/Acquisition" and the "Re-representation of Business Size" cannot be combined with any other mod subtype.
