page.name: dl-ul-download-upload-overview
page.title: Overview
page.body:
This method will allow you to download the template created by the system so that you can work on it offline. Upon completing, you will need to upload the file that you have worked on. The downloaded template will not be updated automatically if any changes are made on the screen related to Wizard Management. If you make changes, you must download, complete, and upload the template again.

This is the best selection if you are entering more than 100 items.

Click Proceed to Download/Upload Template.

page.name: dl-ul-downloading-your-template
page.title: Downloading Your Template
page.body:
Before you can begin entering your pricing data, you must first download the Excel template created by the system.

  1. Click on the Proceed to Download Template button on the Product Template Method main screen.

    2. Click the Proceed to Download Template button.

  2. Click the Download button to download a template created by the system to your computer.

    3. Click the Download button.

  3. Click on the download to open the Excel spreadsheet.

    4. Click on the download.

page.name: dl-ul-pricing-tab
page.title: Pricing Tab
page.body:
Start the interactive lesson below or scroll down for the unabridged step-by-step-instructions.

book Interactive Lesson

presentation/download_pricing_tab_lesson

book Instructions

On this tab, you will enter your general pricing information along with descriptions of your item(s). You must complete each required field as marked with an asterisk (*). Remember to save your work frequently to avoid losing your data.

  1. Entering your pricing data.

    1. Cells marked with an asterisk (*) are required. We suggest you fill out one row in the Excel spreadsheet, save your information, and then attempt to upload for validation purposes. If your document returns errors, it will be much easier to fix them as you go along rather than in a group at the end.

  2. Enter your SIN.

    1. Double click on the first cell and enter your SIN.

      2. Enter your SIN.

  3. Enter the Manufacturer Part Number.

    1. The Manufacturer Part Number (MPN) is the number created by, and assigned to a product by the manufacturer of said product. This field should be entered exactly as provided by the manufacturer, and should not be edited, truncated, or appended in any way. (Example: HSC0424PP)

      2. Enter the MPN.

  4. Enter the Manufacturer Name.

    1. The Manufacturer Name is the name of the entity that is the original manufacturer of the product. (Examples: Honeywell, Samsung, or DeWalt)

      2. Enter the Manufacturer Name.

  5. Enter the Product Type.

    1. For this field, type either "Product" or "Accessory" depending on your offering.

      2. Enter the Product Type.

  6. Enter the Product/Accessory Name.

    1. Enter the name of the product or accessory you are offering.

      2. Enter the Product/Accessory Name.

  7. Enter the UPC/ISBN/GTIN 14/EAN 8/EAN 13.

    1. For this field, enter numbers only between 8 and 14 digits. Most products submitted for sale on a Federal Supply Schedule will follow the UPC-A 12-character format. (Example: 8-92685-00100-3)

      2. Enter the UPC/ISBN/GTIN 14/EAN 8/EAN 13.

  8. Enter the Vendor's Product/Accessory Description.

    1. Enter a brief description of your product or accessory (1,000 character maximum).

      2. Enter the description.

  9. Locate the Unit of Issue Code.

    1. For this field, locate the Code Lookup tab at the bottom of the Excel spreadsheet and refer to the Unit of Issue Name column.

      2. Locate the Unit of Issue Code in its column.

  10. Enter the Unit of Issue.

    1. The Unit of Issue describes in what format, quantity, or packaging a product will be sold. The most common unit of issue is "each," but other examples include, but are not limited to: "box," "pack," or "dozen."

      2. Helpful Hint: For a product like a monitor, which is usually sold individually, the unit of issue would most likely be "each" and the quantity per unit would be "1." However, with products like markers that are sold more than one in a package, the unit of issue would be "package" and the quantity per unit would be the number of markers in the package (e.g. 8).

      Enter the Unit of Issue.

  11. Enter the Quantity Per Unit.

    1. The quantity per unit is the number of individual units that are contained in a unit of issue. For example, with a product such as a monitor, which is usually sold individually, the unit of issue would most likely be "each" and the quantity per unit would be "1." However, with products like markers that are sold more than one in a package, the unit of issue would be "package" and the quantity per unit would be the number of markers in the package.

    12. Enter the Quantity Per Unit.

  12. Enter the Quantity of Product/Unit.

    1. If applicable, enter the quantity of product per unit in the text box provided.

      2. Enter the Quantity of Product Per Unit.

  13. Enter the Vendor Part Number.

    1. If applicable, enter the Vendor Part Number in the text box.

      2. Enter the Vendor Part Number.

  14. Enter the Commercial List Price.

    1. Enter the offer price into the Commercial List Price text box using numbers only, with a maximum of 17 digits before the decimal and 4 digits after the decimal (e.g. 45000.00 for $45,000.00).

      2. Enter the Commercial List Price.

  15. Enter the Name of your Best Priced Customer.

    1. The Best Priced Customer is the name of a customer or category of customers (commercial or government entity) in which your company offers the absolute best price, independent of terms and conditions, discounts, and/or concessions.

      2. Enter the best priced customer's name.

  16. Enter the Price Offered to Best Priced Customer.

    1. Enter the price you offered to the customer from the previous text box into the Price Offered to Best Priced Customer column.

      2. Enter the price offered.

  17. Enter the Discount Offered to Best Priced Customer.

    1. Enter the discount you gave the customer in column M in a percentage format into the Discount Offered to Best Priced Customer column. You can enter up to 8 digits before the decimal point, and 4 digits after it. Do not enter any letters or special characters.

      2. Enter the discount offered.

  18. Save your file.

    1. Save the Excel spreadsheet to your computer.

      2. Save your file.

page.name: dl-ul-non-pricing-tab
page.title: Non-Pricing Tab
page.body:
This tab is where you will enter information not related to pricing, including the production point, warranty information, and product dimensions.

  1. Enter your SIN.

    2. Enter your SIN.

  2. Enter the Manufacturer Part Number.

    1. The Manufacturer Part Number (MPN) is the number assigned to a product by the manufacturer of said product. This field should be entered exactly as provided by the manufacturer, and should not be edited, truncated, or appended in any way. (Example: HSC0424PP)

    3. Enter the Manufacturer Part Number.

  3. Enter the Manufacturer Name.

    1. The Manufacturer Name is the name of the entity that is the original manufacturer of the product. (Examples: Honeywell, Samsung, or DeWalt).

    4. Enter the Manufacturer Name.

  4. Enter the Production Point.

    1. The Production Point is the country in which the product is manufactured. Refer to the Code Lookup tab to locate the code for your item's Production Point.

    5. Enter the Production Point.

  5. If applicable, enter the Production Point 2.

    1. If your product is manufactured in more than one country, use the Production Point 2 field to indicate the additional country. Refer to the Code Lookup tab to locate the code for your item's Production Point 2.

    6. Enter the Production Point 2.

  6. If applicable, enter your Manufacturer Warranty - Warranty Period.

    1. The Manufacturer Warranty - Warranty Period is the unit of time that the manufacturer's warranty is expressed in. Select the appropriate option. Available values are "day," "week," "month," "year," or "lifetime."

    7. Enter your Manufacturer Warranty - Warranty Period.

  7. If applicable, enter the Manufacturer Warranty - Number of Warranty Periods.

    1. The Manufacturer Warranty - Number of Warranty Periods indicates the period that the warranty covers. If your warranty is a one-year warranty, and you selected "year" for "warranty period," you would put a "1" in this field. If you selected a warranty period of "lifetime," you would put "0" in this field.

    8. Enter the Manufacturer Warranty - Number of Warranty Periods.

  8. If applicable, enter the Manufacturer Warranty - Description.

    1. The Manufacturer Warranty - Description is a description of the coverage provided by the manufacturer's warranty. If the terms are spelled out in another place, then provide the location of those terms.

    9. Enter the Manufacturer Warranty - Description.

  9. If applicable, enter the Extended Warranty - Warranty Period.

    1. The Extended Warranty Period is the unit of time that the warranty is expressed in. Select the appropriate option. Available values are "day," "week," "month," "year," or "lifetime."

    10. Enter the Extended Warranty - Warranty Period.

  10. If applicable, enter the Extended Warranty - Number of Warranty Periods.

    1. The Extended Warranty - Number of Warranty Periods is the period that the manufacturer's extended warranty covers. If the extended warranty is a one-year warranty, and you selected "year" for "Extended Warranty - Warranty Period," would enter "1" in this text box. If you selected a warranty period of "lifetime," you would enter "0" in this field.

    11. Enter the number of warranty periods for the extended warranty.

  11. If applicable, enter the Extended Warranty - Description.

    1. The Extended Warranty Description is a description of the coverage provided by the manufacturer's extended warranty. If the terms are spelled out in another place, then provide the location of those terms.

    12. Enter the Extended Warranty - Description.

  12. If applicable, enter the Product Length - Unit Number.

    1. The Product Length - Unit Number is the numerical measurement of a product as measured from side to side. This field is for defining the numerical value only. The unit of measure will be defined in a separate field.

    13. Enter the Product Length - Unit Number.

  13. If applicable, enter the Product Length - Unit of Measure.

    1. The Product Length - Unit of measure is the standard unit that was used to measure the product's length. Examples of units of measure are: "feet", "inches", or "meters."

    14. Enter the Product Length - Unit of Measure.

  14. If applicable, enter the Product Width - Unit Number.

    1. The Product Width - Unit Number is the numerical measurement of a product as measured from side to side. This field is for defining the numerical value only. The unit of measure will be defined in a separate field.

    15. Enter the Product Width - Unit Number.

  15. If applicable, enter the Product Width - Unit of Measure.

    1. The Product Width - Unit of Measure is the standard unit that was used to measure the width of the product. Examples of units of measure are: "feet," "inches," or "meters."

    16. Enter the Product Width - Unit of Measure.

  16. If applicable, enter the Product Height - Unit Number.

    1. The Product Length - Unit Number is the numerical measurement of a product as measured from side to side. This field is for defining the numerical value only. The unit of measure will be defined in a separate field.

    17. Enter the Product Height - Unit Number.

  17. If applicable, enter the Product Height - Unit of Measure.

    1. The Product Height is the standard unit that was used to measure the product's height. Examples of units of measure are: "feet," "inches," or "meters."

    18. Enter the Product Height - Unit of Measure.

  18. If applicable, enter the Product Specific Web Site.

    1. The Product Specific Website is used to provide a URL for a page with data specific to this product. For example, if you maintain your own online catalog, you may opt to provide a link to this page.

    19. Enter the Product Specific Web Site.

  19. If applicable, enter the Standard Pack.

    1. The Standard Pack is the unit of measure you consistently sell items in packages of a specific size and type. This field is optional. Standard packs always consist of multiple quantities of the same item. Standard packs do not contain multiple items. For example: 12.

    20. Enter the Standard Pack.

  20. If applicable, enter the Delivery (Lead) Time Days.

    1. The Delivery (Lead) Time Days is the number of days it will take for the product to meet the established delivery (lead) time code. This field is for defining the numerical value only. For example, if you plan to select "AE" for your Delivery (Lead) Time Code and enter "5" into the Delivery (Lead) Time Days field, then the expectation is that the product will ship (leave your company) 5 days after you receive the order.

    21. Enter the Delivery (Lead) Time Days.

  21. Enter the Delivery (Lead) Time Code.

    1. Use this field to identify the method in which your company determines delivery lead time. The choices are as follows:

      • AF for time delivered after receipt of order

      • AE for time shipped after receipt

    22. Enter the Delivery (Lead) Time Code.

  22. If applicable enter the Federal Supply Classification/Product Service Code (FSC/PSC), the United Nations Standard Products and Services Code (UNSPSC), and/or the National Stock Number (NSN). These are numerical indicator codes that further define an item.

    23. Enter the FSC/PSC, UNSPSC, and/or NSN.

  23. If applicable, enter the Default Color.

    24. Enter the Default Color.

  24. Click the Save button to ensure your work is not lost.

    25. Save your work.

page.name: dl-ul-special-charges-tab
page.title: Special Charges Tab
page.body:
Start the interactive lesson below or scroll down for the unabridged step-by-step-instructions.

book Interactive Lesson

presentation/download_special_charges_lesson

book Instructions

This tab corresponds to the selections you made earlier in the Special Charges section of Wizard Management in eOffer.

  1. Enter your SIN.

    2. Enter your SIN.

  2. Enter the Manufacturer Part Number.

    1. The Manufacturer Part Number (MPN) is the number created by, and assigned to a product by the manufacturer of said product. This field should be entered exactly as provided by the manufacturer, and should not be edited, truncated, or appended in any way. (Example: HSC0424PP)

    3. Enter the Manufacturer Part Number.

  3. Enter the Manufacturer Name.

    1. The Manufacturer Name is the name of the entity that is the original manufacturer of the product. (Examples: Honeywell, Samsung, or DeWalt)

    4. Enter the Manufacturer Name.

  4. Refer back to the Special Charges section of Wizard Management that you completed earlier in eOffer. It is imperative that you only fill in information in your template for the charges you selected previously.

    5. Only complete Special Charges from those you selected previously in eOffer.

  5. Locate the column that corresponds to your earlier selection(s). For instructional purposes, we will complete the columns for "Expediting Premium."

  6. Complete the Charges field.

    1. For this field, enter a number that represents the dollar amount your company will charge.

    7. For this example, we will fill out the Charges field.

  7. Complete the Per field.

    1. For this field, you will need the Unit of Issue Code to which your charge applies. Refer to the Code Lookup tab for a complete list of Units of Issue and their corresponding codes. You may have to scroll down to locate your code.

      2. Use the Code Lookup sheet as a reference for Special Charges.

    2. Enter your code.

      3. Enter your code.

  8. Enter a description explaining the special charge.

    9. Enter a description explaining the special charge.

  9. Click the Save button to ensure your data is not lost.

    10. Click Save.

  10. Repeats steps 2-8 for any additional items.

page.name: dl-ul-special-features-tab
page.title: Special Features Tab
page.body:
This tab corresponds to the selections you made in the Special Features section of Wizard Management. Be sure to only enter information for fields that match your earlier choices.

  1. Enter your SIN.

    2. Enter your SIN.

  2. Enter the Manufacturer Part Number.

    1. The Manufacturer Part Number (MPN) is the number created by and assigned to a product by the manufacturer. This field should be entered exactly as provided by the manufacturer, and should not be edited, truncated, or appended in any way.

    3. Enter the Manufacturer Part Number.

  3. Enter the Manufacturer Name.

    1. The Manufacturer Name is the name of the entity that is the original manufacturer of the product. (Examples: Honeywell, Samsung, or DeWalt)

    4. Enter the Manufacturer Name.

  4. Recall the Special Features selections you made as part of Wizard Management earlier in the process. It is imperative that you only enter data for the selections you made previously. The other columns can remain blank.

    5. Only enter information in columns that correspond to features you previously selected in eOffer.

  5. Scroll to locate the Environmental Features that apply to your item. For instructional purposes, we will complete the column pertaining to "Green Seal Item."

    6. For the purpose of this lesson, we will complete the Green Seal Item field.

  6. You will need to locate the code that corresponds with your Special Feature.

    1. On the Code Lookup tab, use the Special Feature Message column to locate your Special Feature, then find the row to the left to determine the appropriate code.

    7. Use the Code Lookup page as a reference for what to enter within the spreadsheet.

  7. Copy and paste that code into the appropriate cell.

    8. Copy and paste the correct code into the corresponding cell.

  8. Next, scroll to find Special Features that correspond with your earlier selection.

    9. Continue to fill out other applicable Special Features.

  9. Repeat steps -7 with this field.

    10. Repeat the previous steps to fill out each special feature.

  10. When you are finished, click the save button to ensure your data is not lost.

    11. Click Save.

page.name: dl-ul-delivery
page.title: Delivery
page.body:
This is where you will enter your Delivery information. You must complete each required field as marked with an asterisk (*).

  1. Enter your SIN.

    2. Enter your SIN.

  2. Enter the Manufacturer Part Number.

    1. The Manufacturer Part Number (MPN) is the number created by, and assigned to a product by the manufacturer of said product. This field should be entered exactly as provided by the manufacturer, and should not be edited, truncated, or appended in any way. (Example: HSC0424PP)

    3. Enter the Manufacturer Part Number.

  3. Enter the Manufacturer Name.

    1. The Manufacturer Name is the name of the entity that is the original manufacturer of the product. (Examples: Honeywell, Samsung, or DeWalt)

    4. Enter the Manufacturer Name.

  4. Enter Delivery - FOB Continental US.

    1. Free On Board (FOB) defines delivery options. Use this field to select the type of delivery you offer within the Continental US. The choices are as follows:

      • O - Origin - shipping is paid by the seller

      • D - Destination - shipping is paid by the buyer

    5. Enter the Delivery FOB.

  5. Enter Delivery FOB - Alaska.

    1. Free On Board (FOB) defines delivery options. Use this field to select the type of delivery you offer to Alaska. The choices are as follows:

      • O - Origin - shipping is paid by the seller

      • D - Destination - shipping is paid by the buyer

      • ND - Delivery is not offered to this destination

    6. Enter Delibert FOB - Alaska.

  6. Enter Delivery FOB - Hawaii.

    1. Free On Board (FOB) defines delivery options. Use this field to select the type of delivery you offer to Hawaii. The choices are as follows:

      • O - Origin - shipping is paid by the seller

      • D - Destination - shipping is paid by the buyer

      • ND - Delivery is not offered to this destination

    7. Enter Delibert FOB - Hawaii.

  7. Enter Delivery FOB - Puerto Rico.

    1. Free On Board (FOB) defines delivery options. Use this field to select the type of delivery you offer to Puerto Rico. The choices are as follows:

      • O - Origin - shipping is paid by the seller

      • D - Destination - shipping is paid by the buyer

      • ND - Delivery is not offered to this destination

    8. Enter Delivery FOB - Puerto Rico.

  8. Enter the Shipping Unit Weight.

    1. When Free on Board (FOB) is origin, the shipping weight is articulated in terms of a number and a unit of measure. The shipping weight unit of measure is the standard unit that was used to measure the weight of the packaged product. Examples of units of measure are: "pounds," "grams," "tons.";

    9. Enter the Shipping Unit Weight.

  9. Enter the Shipping Package Cube.

    1. The shipping package cube is the size of the shipping package measured in cubic feet. This field is required when the Free on Board (FOB) point value is Origin (O).

    10. Enter the Shipping Package Cube.

  10. Click the Save button to ensure your data is not lost.

    11. Click Save.

page.name: dl-ul-zonal-pricing
page.title: Zonal Pricing
page.body:
This tab corresponds to the selections you made earlier in the Zonal Pricing section of Wizard Management in eOffer.

  1. Enter your SIN.

    2. Enter your SIN.

  2. Enter the Manufacturer Part Number.

    1. The Manufacturer Part Number (MPN) is the number created by and assigned to a product by the manufacturer. This field should be entered exactly as provided by the manufacturer, and should not be edited, truncated, or appended in any way.

    3. Enter the Manufacturer Part Number.

  3. Enter the Manufacturer Name.

    1. The Manufacturer Name is the name of the entity that is the original manufacturer of the product. (Examples: Honeywell, Samsung, or DeWalt)

    4. Enter the Manufacturer Name.

  4. Enter the Zonal Offer Price.

    1. This is the price you at which you are offering your product/accessory to customers in a designated zone.

    5. Enter the Zonal Offer Price.

  5. Enter the Zone Number.

    1. This number corresponds to the zonal areas you set up in the Zonal Pricing section as part of Wizard Management.

    6. Enter the Zone Number.

  6. Click the Save button to ensure your data is not lost.

    7. Click Save.

page.name: dl-ul-photos
page.title: Photos
page.body:
Start the interactive lesson below or scroll down for the unabridged step-by-step-instructions.

book Interactive Lesson

presentation/download_photos_lesson

book Instructions

If you answered "Yes" to Photos in the Wizard Management section, you will see this tab added onto your template.

  1. Enter your SIN.

    2. Enter your SIN.

  2. Enter the Manufacturer Part Number.

    1. The Manufacturer Part Number (MPN) is the number created by and assigned to a product by the manufacturer. This field should be entered exactly as provided by the manufacturer, and should not be edited, truncated, or appended in any way.

    3. Enter the Manufacturer Part Number.

  3. Enter the Manufacturer Name.

    1. The Manufacturer Name is the name of the entity that is the original manufacturer of the product. (Examples: Honeywell, Samsung, or DeWalt)

    4. Enter the Manufacturer Name.

  4. Enter the name and file extension exactly as it appears on your computer in the Additional Photo 1 column.

    5. Enter the photo file name and extension.

  5. Repeat Step 4 for any other photos you wish to add. You can add a maximum of three (3) additional photos.

    6. Enter additional photo file names and extensions.

  6. Click the save button to ensure your data is not lost.

    7. Click Save.

page.name: dl-ul-options
page.title: Options
page.body:
If you answered "Yes" to Options in the Wizard Management section, you will see this tab on your template.

  1. Enter your SIN.

    2. Enter your SIN.

  2. Enter the Manufacturer Part Number.

    1. The Manufacturer Part Number (MPN) is the number created by and assigned to a product by the manufacturer. This field should be entered exactly as provided by the manufacturer, and should not be edited, truncated, or appended in any way.

    3. Enter the Manufacturer Part Number.

  3. Enter the Manufacturer Name.

    1. The Manufacturer Name is the name of the entity that is the original manufacturer of the product. (Examples: Honeywell, Samsung, or DeWalt)

    4. Enter the Manufacturer Name.

  4. Enter the Option Part Number.

    1. This is same as the Manufacturer Part Number, only now, this number will be associated with the option.

    5. Enter the Option Part Number.

  5. Enter the Option Manufacturer.

    6. Enter the Option Manufacturer.

  6. Enter the Option Group.

    1. This is a free text field and will be treated as a title for the options that are included with the product.

    7. Enter the Option Group.

  7. Enter the Option Code.

    1. There are four different choices for the Option Code field:

      • "I" indicates the option is included as a feature of product

      • "S" indicates the option can be substitutes

      • "A" indicates the option can be added

      • "O" indicates none can be selected

    8. Enter the Option Code.

  8. Enter whether the Option is deletable by using "Y" or "N."

    9. Enter if the Option is deletable.

  9. Enter the Option Quantity.

    10. Enter the Option Quanitty.

  10. Enter the Option Unit of Measure.

    1. The Unit of Measure functions in the same way the Unit of Issue does with Products. A list of Units of Issue can be found on the Code Lookup tab.

    11. Enter the Option Unit of Measure.

  11. Enter the Option Price.

    12. Enter the Option Price.

  12. Enter the Option Description.

    13. Enter the Option Description.

  13. Click the Save button to ensure your work is not lost.

    14. Click Save.

page.name: dl-ul-accessories
page.title: Accessories
page.body:
If you answered "Yes" to Accessories in the Wizard Management section, you will see this tab in your template.

  1. Enter your SIN.

    2. Enter your SIN.

  2. Enter the Manufacturer Part Number.

    1. The Manufacturer Part Number (MPN) is the number created by and assigned to a product by the manufacturer. This field should be entered exactly as provided by the manufacturer, and should not be edited, truncated, or appended in any way.

    3. Enter the Manufacturer Part Number.

  3. Enter the Manufacturer Name.

    1. The Manufacturer Name is the name of the entity that is the original manufacturer of the product. (Examples: Honeywell, Samsung, or DeWalt)

    4. Enter the Manufacturer Name.

  4. Enter the Accessory Part Number.

    5. Enter the Accessory Part Number.

  5. Enter the Accessory Manufacturer.

    6. Enter the Accessory Manufacturer.

  6. Click the Save button to ensure your data is not lost.

    7. Click Save.

page.name: dl-ul-uploading-your-template-file
page.title: Uploading Your Template File
page.body:
When you have completed each required field in the downloaded template and saved your work, you are ready to re-upload it into the system.

  1. When you have completed each field in the downloaded template, you are ready to re-upload it into the system. On the Download/Upload Product Template screen, click on the Choose File button.

    2. Click on the Choose File button.

  2. Navigate to the location where you saved your completed downloaded template.

    3. Locate your saved template.

  3. Click the Start Upload button.

    4. Click the Start Upload button.

  4. You will see your file added to a table at the bottom of the screen and the Upload Status will read "In Progress."

    5. Note the Upload Status.

  5. Click the Refresh Status button periodically until your status changes.

    6. Refresh the status.

  6. If your status changes to "Failed:"

    1. Click the link that reads Click HERE for Errors to download an Excel document that contains your errors.

      2. Open the document to view your errors.

    2. An Excel document will open that contains all of the information you previously entered, along with a Validation Messages field for any tab that contains errors.

      3. View your errors.

    3. After you edit your content to address all reported errors, save your document.

    4. Delete the current document from the system.

      5. Delete the previous document from the system.

    5. Click Yes on the Confirm Delete message.

      6. Click Yes.

    6. Repeat steps 1-5.

  7. If your status changes to "Complete:"

    1. Your document does not contain any errors and you can move onto the next step.

      2. When the Upload Status reads "Complete," your document contains no errors.

page.name: ppr-download-upload
page.title: Download/Upload Price Reduction Entry
page.body:
1. On the Product Template screen, click the Download button.

    2. Click Download.

  2. Open the download and first, enter the SIN.

    3. Enter your SIN.

  3. Next, enter the Manufacturer Part Number.

    4. Enter the Manufacturer Part Number.

  4. Enter the Manufacturer Name.

    5. Enter the Manufacturer Name.

  5. Enter the Zone Number.

    6. Enter the Zone Number.

  6. Enter the Start Date of your price reduction.

    7. Enter the Start Date.

  7. Enter the Proposed Price excluding the Industrial Finding Fee.

    8. Enter the Proposed Price.

  8. Click the save icon in the top-left corner of the document.

    9. Save your work.

  9. Back on the Product Template screen, click on the Choose File button and navigate to your saved template file.

    10. Choose your file.

  10. Click the Start Upload button.

    11. Click Start Upload.

  11. You will see your file added to a table at the bottom of the screen with an Upload Status of "In Progress."

    12. "In Progress" Upload Status.

  12. Click the Refresh Status button periodically until your status changes.

    13. Refresh the status.

  13. If your status changes to "Failed:"

    1. Click on the link in the Upload Status column to open a document containing your errors.

      2. "Failed" Upload Status.

    2. Make the required corrections within your template file and save your document.

    3. Delete the original file from the system by clicking on the Delete File button.

    4. Click Yes on the Confirm Delete screen.

      5. Click Yes.

    5. Repeat steps 9-12 until you status displays as "Complete," then proceed to step 14.

  14. When your status displays as "Complete:"

    1. Click the Go To Capture Pricing button at the bottom of the screen.

    2. Proceed to the Generate Pricing Document.

page.name: on-screen-data-entry-overview
page.title: Overview
page.body:
This method will allow you to enter the product details on the screen online. You can copy and paste your product details on the grid provided on the screen. You will be required to click the "Save Products" after completing each step.

This method works best when you have fewer than 100 products and would be online while entering the product details.

  1. Click the Proceed to Enter On Screen button on the Product Template Method main screen.

    2. Click the Proceed to Enter On Screen button.

  2. Choose a SIN from the drop-down menu. The SINs that were added in the offer will be listed here.

    3. Choose your SIN from the drop-down menu.

  3. The on-screen data grid has been customized based upon the selections made within the Wizard Template. The sections that were answered as "Yes" within the Wizard Template will now appear as tabs on the screen.

    4. A look at the on-screen data grid.

page.name: on-screen-get-started-tab
page.title: Get Started Tab
page.body:
Start the interactive lesson below or scroll down for the unabridged step-by-step-instructions.

book Interactive Lesson

presentation/get_started_tab_lesson

book Instructions

In this section, you will enter your Manufacturer Part Number and Name for each product included under the selected SIN. You will be able to add multiple products/accessories in this section, but only one per row.

This information will be transferred to other tabs in this section.

  1. Select your SIN from the drop-down menu.

    2. Select your SIN.

  2. Click the Select button.

    3. Click the Select button.

  3. Enter the Manufacturer Part Number.

    • The Manufacturer Part Number (MPN) is the number created by and assigned to a product by the manufacturer. This field should be entered exactly as provided by the manufacturer, and should not be edited, truncated, or appended in any way.

      • Enter the Manufacturer Part Number.

  4. Enter the Manufacturer Name.

    • The Manufacturer Name is the name of the original manufacturer of the product and is a maximum of 40 characters.

    Enter the Manufacturer Name.

  5. Select the Product/Accessory Type from the drop-down menu.

    6. Select the Product/Accessory Type.

  6. Click the Save Products button after completing each row. If you do not save your work frequently, you will lose your information if you navigate away from this page or your session times out.

    7. Screenshot of the Save Products button.

  7. Click OK on the Product Confirmation pop-up window.

    8. Click OK.

  8. Repeat steps 3-7 to add other products/accessories under this SIN

page.name: on-screen-pricing-tab
page.title: Pricing Tab
page.body:
Start the interactive lesson below or scroll down for the unabridged step-by-step-instructions.

book Interactive Lesson

presentation/pricing_tab_lesson

book Instructions

On this tab, you will enter your general pricing information along with descriptions of your item(s). You must complete each required field as marked with an asterisk (*). Remember to save your work frequently to avoid losing your data.

  1. You will notice that the Manufacturer Part Number, Manufacturer Name, and Product/Accessory Type have been auto-populated from your responses on the Get Started tab. Ensure each field is correct before moving on.

    2. Note the auto-populated information.

  2. Enter the Product/Accessory Name. Be sure to use the name that the manufacturer has given to the product.

    3. Enter the Product/Accessory Name.

  3. If applicable, enter the UPC into the text box.

    • A Universal Product Code (UPC) is a unique identification code that is assigned to a product by a governing organization. UPCs can take several formats, ranging from 8 to 14 digits. Most products submitted for sale on a Federal Supply Schedule will follow the UPC-A 12 character format.

    Enter the UPC.

  4. Enter the Vendor's Product/Accessory Description.

    • The vendor's product or accessory description is the description as created or provided by the seller. This description may be different than the description provided by the manufacturer.

    Enter the Vendor's Product/Accessory Description.

  5. Select the Unit of Issue using the drop-down menu. Use the scroll bar to search for the appropriate selection.

    • The Unit of Issue describes in what format, quantity, or packaging a product will be sold. The most common unit of issue is "each," but other examples include, but are not limited to: "box," "pack," or "dozen."

    Select the Unit of Issue.

  6. Enter the Quantity Per Unit.

    • An example of this field would be for a product like a laptop, which is usually sold individually. In this example, the Unit of issue would most likely be "each" and the quantity per unit would be "1." However, with products like markers that are sold more than one in a package, the unit of issue would be "package" and the quantity per unit would be the number of markers in the package.

    Enter the Quantity Per Unit.

  7. If applicable, select the Quantity of Product/Unit.

    • To continue the example above, with a product such as a monitor, which is usually sold individually, the Unit of Issue would most likely be "each" and the quantity per unit would be "1." However, with products like markers that are sold more than one in a package, the unit of issue would be "package" and the quantity per unit would be the number of markers in the package.

    Select the Quantity of Product/Unit.

  8. If applicable, enter the Vendor Part Number.

    • The Vendor Part Number is an optional field used to identify a company-specific part number. This term is also known as the contractor's part number.

    Enter the Vendor Part Number.

  9. Enter the Commercial List Price.

    • Enter the price at which you offer your item commercially into the Commercial List Price text box using numbers only, with a maximum of 17 digits before the decimal and 4 digits after the decimal (i.e. $45,000.00).

    Enter the Commercial List Price.

  10. Enter the Best Priced Customer.

    • This indicates the customer or category of customers (commercial or government entity) to which your company offers the absolute best price, independent of terms, conditions, discounts, and/or concessions.

    Enter the Best Priced Customer.

  11. Enter the Price Offered to the Best Priced Customer.

    12. Enter the Price Offered to the Best Priced Customer.

  12. Enter the Discount Offered to the Best Priced Customer.

    • You will need to calculate the discount between the Commercial List Price and the Price Offered to Best Priced Customer using a percentage.

    Enter the Discount Offered to the Best Priced Customer.

  13. If applicable, select the Manufacturer Warranty - Warranty Period from the drop-down menu.

    14. Select the Manufacturer Warranty - Warranty Period.

  14. If applicable, enter the number of warranty periods.

    • If you selected "Lifetime" as the Warranty Period, enter "0" in this field.

    Enter the Number of Warranty Periods for the Manufacturer's Warranty.

  15. If applicable, enter the Manufacturer Warranty - Description.

    16. Enter a Description of the Manufacturer's Warranty.

  16. Select the Production Point from the drop-down menu.

    • The Production Point is the country in which the product is manufactured.

    Select the Production Point.

  17. If applicable, select the Production Point 2 from the drop-down menu.

    18. Select the Production Point 2.

  18. If applicable, enter the Delivery (Lead) Time Days.

    • The number of days it will take for the product to meet the established delivery (lead) time code. This field is for defining the numerical value only. For example, if you selected AE for Delivery (Lead) Time Code and enter 5 days, then the expectation is the product will ship (leave your company) five (5) days after you receive the order.

    Enter the Delivery (Lead) Time Days.

  19. Select the Delivery (Lead) Time Code.

    • Use this field to identify the method in which your company determines delivery lead time.

    • Using the drop-down menu, select the code that applies to your item.

    Select the Delivery (Lead) Time Code.

  20. If applicable, enter the FSC/PSC (Federal Supply Code/Product Supply Code), UNSPSC (United Nations Standard Products and Services Code), and NSN (National Stock Number). These are numerical indicators that further define an item.

    21. Enter the FSC/PSC, UNSPSC, and NSN, if applicable.

  21. Click the Save Pricing button.

    • You MUST click the Save Pricing button before completing another row or moving onto another tab. If you do not click this button, all of your data will be lost.

    Save your work.

  22. Click OK on the Product Confirmation pop-up message.

    23. Click OK.

page.name: on-screen-additional-photos-tab
page.title: Additional Photos Tab
page.body:
Start the interactive lesson below or scroll down for the unabridged step-by-step-instructions.

book Interactive Lesson

presentation/additional_photos_lesson

book Instructions

If you answered "Yes" to Photos in the Wizard Management section, you will see this tab added onto your template.

  1. Click on the Additional Photos tab.

    2. Click on the Additional Photos tab.

  2. Note the auto-populated information.

    3. Note the auto-populated information.

  3. Click on the text box under Additional Photo 1 and type in the exact name of the photo you wish to upload, including the file extension (i.e. battery_001.jpg).

    4. Type in the exact name of the photo you want to upload.

    You must type the filename of your photo exactly; otherwise, when you go to upload your photo in a subsequent step, you will not be successful.

  4. Repeat step 3 for any additional photos.

  5. Click the Save Photos button.

    6. Click the Save Photos button.

  6. Click OK on the Product Confirmation pop-up box.

    7. Click OK.

page.name: on-screen-zonal-offer-price-tab
page.title: Zonal Offer Price Tab
page.body:
Start the interactive lesson below or scroll down for the unabridged step-by-step-instructions.

book Interactive Lesson

presentation/zonal_offer_lesson

book Instructions

If you answered "Yes" to Zonal Pricing in the Wizard Management section, you will see this tab added onto your template.

  1. Some of the data you entered in previous tabs has been auto-populated into this tab. Double check that this information is correct before moving on.

    2. Note the auto-populated information.

  2. Enter the first Offer Price. The offer price is the price you will sell this product or accessory to government buyers, not including the Industrial Funding Fee (IFF).

    3. Enter the first Offer Price.

  3. The final price including industrial funding fee (IFF) is automatically calculated based on your offer price. It includes the IFF, which you will later remit to the government. As soon as you click on this cell, the 01 Final Price (Incl. IFF) ($) field will be calculated for you.

    4. The final price including industrial funding fee is calculated for you.

  4. Enter the second Offer Price. The second offer price corresponds to the zone we labeled "02."

    5. Enter the second Offer Price.

  5. Note the second Final Price. The 02 Final Price (IFF) ($) field will be automatically calculated for you.

    6. The 02 Final Price (IFF) ($) field will be automatically calculated for you.

  6. Click the Save Zonal Pricing button to ensure your data is not lost.

    7. Click Save Zonal Pricing.

  7. On the Product Confirmation pop-up message, click OK.

Click OK.

page.name: on-screen-accessories-tab
page.title: Accessories Tab
page.body:
If you answered "Yes" to Accessories in the Wizard Management section, you will see this tab added onto your template.

  1. Note the auto-populated information. Ensure the Manufacturer Part Number and Name, and the Product/Accessory Type, are correct before moving on.

    2. Note the auto-populated information.

  2. Click on the Map/View Accessories button.

    3. Click on the Map/View Accessories button.

  3. Check the box for all the accessories associated with the product.

    4. Check the box for all the accessories associated with the product.

  4. Click the Save Accessories button.

    5. Click the Save Accessories button.

  5. Click OK on the Product Confirmation pop-up screen.

    6. Click OK

  6. Repeat steps 2-4 for any additional rows.

page.name: on-screen-special-charges-tab
page.title: Special Charges Tab
page.body:
Start the interactive lesson below or scroll down for the unabridged step-by-step-instructions.

book Interactive Lesson

presentation/special_charges_tab_lesson

book Instructions

If you answered "Yes" to Special Charges in the Wizard Management section, you will see this tab added onto your template. The selections you made earlier in the Special Charges section will be reflected here.

  1. Some of the data you entered in previous tabs has been auto-populated into this tab. Double check that this information is correct before moving on.

    2. Note the auto-populated information.

  2. Click the Add/View Special Charges button.

    3. Click the Add/View Special Charges button.

  3. Enter your charges. If you selected more than one Special Charge in the previous section, you will see multiple rows in the Add Special Charges table.

    4. Enter your Special Charges.

  4. Select your unit for pricing. You will notice there are a number of choices from which to choose.

    5. Select your unit for pricing.

  5. Enter your Descriptions/Conditions.

    • Example: A product includes One Day Service which costs $7.00 per item but is only applicable in the contiguous US.

    Enter your Descriptions/Conditions.

  6. Click the Save Special Charges button to ensure your work is not lost.

    7. Save your work.

  7. Click OK on the Product Confirmation pop-up message.

    8. Click OK.

page.name: on-screen-delivery-tab
page.title: Delivery Tab
page.body:
This section is required and was automatically selected for you in the Wizard Management section.

  1. Some of the data you entered in previous tabs has been auto-populated into this tab. Double check that this information is correct before moving on.

    2. Note the auto-populated information.

  2. Make your delivery selection for CONUS (contiguous United States) from the drop-down menu.

    3. Make your delivery selection for CONUS.

    FOB stands for Free on Board. You will have three FOB delivery options from which to choose: FOB Origin indicates shipping is paid by the seller, FOB Desitnation indicates shipping is paid by the buyer, and FOB No Delivery means the seller does not offer delivery to that State.

  3. Make your delivery selections for the remaining fields.

    4. Make selections for the remaining fields.

  4. Enter the Shipping Unit Weight.

    • The Shipping Unit Weight is the numerical measurement of the weight of the packaged product.

    Enter the Shipping Unit Weight.

  5. Enter the Shipping Package Cube.

    • The Shipping Package Cube is the size of the shipping package measured in cubic feet. This field is required when the Free on Board (FOB) point value is Origin (O).

    Enter the Shipping Package Cube.

  6. Click the Save Delivery button.

    7. Click Save Delivery.

  7. Click OK on the Product Confirmation pop-up message.

    8. Click OK.

page.name: on-screen-special-features-tab
page.title: Special Features Tab
page.body:
Start the interactive lesson below or scroll down for the unabridged step-by-step-instructions.

book Interactive Lesson

presentation/special_features_tab_lesson

book Instructions

The selections you made in the Special Features section of Wizard Management will be reflected in this table.

  1. Some of the data you entered in previous tabs has been auto-populated into this tab. Double check that this information is correct before moving on.

    2. Note the auto-populated information.

  2. Check the boxes that apply to your product. If a Special Feature does not apply, leave it unchecked.

    3. Check the boxes that apply to your product.

  3. Click the Save Special Features button.

    4. Click Save Special Features.

  4. Click OK on the Product Confirmation pop-up message.

    5. Click OK.

page.name: on-screen-dimensions-and-shipping-tab
page.title: Dimensions and Shipping Tab
page.body:
In this section, you will enter your product's specifications such as color, length, height, and width, among others.

  1. Note the auto-populated information. Ensure the information is correct before moving on.

    2. Note the auto-populated information.

  2. If applicable, enter the Default Color.

    3. Enter the Default Color.

  3. If applicable, enter the Product Length - Unit Number.

    1. The Product Length - Unit Number is the numerical measurement of a product as measured from side to side. This field is for defining the numerical value only. The unit of measure will be defined in a separate field.

    4. Enter the Product Length - Unit Number.

  4. If applicable, enter the Product Length - Unit of Measure.

    1. The Product Length - Unit Measure is the standard unit that was used to measure the number of units. Examples of units of measure are: "feet", "inches", or "meters".

    5. Enter the Product Length - Unit Measure.

  5. If applicable, enter the Product Width – Unit Number.

    1. The Product Width - Unit Number is the numerical measurement of a product as measured from side to side. This field is for defining the numerical value only. The unit of measure will be defined in a separate field.

    6. Enter the Product Width - Unit Number.

  6. If applicable, enter the Product Width – Unit of Measure.

    1. The Product Width - Unit of Measure is the standard unit that was used to measure the number of units. Examples of units of measure are: "feet," "inches," or "meters."

    7. Enter the Product Width - Unit of Measure.

  7. If applicable, enter the Product Height – Unit Number.

    1. The product length unit number is the numerical measurement of a product as measured from side to side. This field is for defining the numerical value only.

    8. Enter the Product Height – Unit Number.

  8. If applicable, enter the Product Height – Unit of Measure.

    1. The Product Height – Unit of Measure is the standard unit that was used to measure the height of the product. Examples of units of measure are: "feet", "inches", or "meters".

    9. Enter the Product Height – Unit of Measure.

  9. If applicable, enter the Product Specific Web Site.

    1. The product specific website is used to provide a URL for a page with data specific to this product. For example, if you maintain your own online catalog, you may opt to provide a link to this page.

    10. Enter the Product Specific Web Site.

  10. If applicable, enter the Standard Package Size.

    1. The standard package size is the unit of measure you consistently sell items in packages of a specific size and type. This field is optional. Standard packs always consist of multiple quantities of the same item. Standard packs do not contain mixes of items. For example: 12.

    11. Enter the Standard Package Size.

  11. Click the Save Dimensions & Shipping button.

    12. Click Save Dimensions & Shipping.

  12. Click OK on the Product Confirmation pop-up message.

    13. Click OK.

page.name: upload-additional-photos
page.title: Upload Additional Photos
page.body:
After you have entered the file names of any additional photos into your template, you are now ready to upload the actual photo files. You must ensure the photo file(s) you upload have the exact same names as the ones you entered earlier.

  1. On the Capture and Generate Pricing main screen, locate STEP 1B at the bottom-left of your screen.

    2. Locate STEP 1B.

  2. Click on the Upload Additional Photos button.

    3. Click on Upload Additional Photos.

  3. Click on the Choose File button and navigate to the file that matches exactly with the name of the photo you entered previously.

    4. Choose your file.

  4. Once your file has been chosen, click the Upload File button.

    5. Click the Upload File button.

  5. You will see your photo added to the table at the bottom of the screen.

    6. Your photo has been added to the table.

  6. Repeat steps 3-5 for any additional photos you wish you add.

  7. Click the Go To Capture Pricing button to complete this section.

    8. Click the Go To Capture Pricing button.

page.name: generate-offer-analysis-report
page.title: Generate Offer Analysis Report
page.body:
Start the interactive lesson below or scroll down for the unabridged step-by-step-instructions.

book Interactive Lesson

presentation/generate_offer_analysis_lesson

book Instructions

Completing this section will trigger the process to generate the Offer Analysis Report. Generation of the document can take up to 30 minutes depending on the number of products. You must complete this section before generating your pricing document.

  1. To enable this button, ensure all of the following validations are met:

    • at least one product/accessory, with all the required details, is associated with each SIN

    • data is captured for all required fields

    • data is entered as per specified format (where applicable)

  2. From the Capture and Generate Pricing Screen, click on the Generate Offer Analysis Report button.

    3. Click on the Generate Offer Analysis Report button.

  3. If the status of your report reads "Generation of Offer Analysis Report: In Progress," it is still generating and not yet ready for the next step.

    4. Note the status of your report.

  4. It may take up to 30 minutes for your status to change. To refresh the status of your report, click the Check Status button.

    5. Click the Check Status button.

  5. When the system has finished running your report, you will notice that the status has changed to "Complete."

    6. Note the "Complete" status.

  6. Click the Go To Offer Analysis Report button.

    7. Helpful Hint: You must click this link and fix any errors before moving on. If you do not complete this step first, you will not receive an accurate final pricing document.

    Click on the Go To Offer Analysis Report button.

  7. You will be taken to a screen that includes two tabs:

    • Line Items: Required Action

    • Line Items: Require No Action

    You will need to correct all errors under the Line Items: Required Action tab.

    8. View the section(s) that require action.

  8. Click on the button in the Action column. As an example, we will be working with errors in the Pricing section.

    9. View the section(s) that require action.

  9. To continue our example, this table indicates that the prices we entered are too high and need to be adjusted to fall within the target prices.

    10. A look at the Pricing items that require action.

  10. By clicking in the cell under New Offer Price, you can change the price to fall within the Target Price (Incl. IFF) that has been provided.

    11. Adjusting pricing to fall within the Target Prices.

  11. Now that we have adjusted the prices, click the Save Changes button.

    12. Save your changes.

  12. Click OK on the Standard Response Confirmation pop-up message.

    13. Click OK.

  13. You will notice all cells are clear under the Line Items: Required Action tab.

    14. When the Line Items: Required Action field is blank, you have corrected all errors.

  14. Click the Save Standard Responses button.

    15. Click Save Standard Responses.

  15. Click OK on the Standard Response Confirmation pop-up message.

    16. Click OK.

  16. Back on the Capture and Generate Pricing screen, your status should read "Generation of Offer Analysis report is Complete."

    17. Note the "Complete" status.

page.name: generate-pricing-document
page.title: Generate Pricing Document
page.body:
Start the interactive lesson below or scroll down for the unabridged step-by-step-instructions.

book Interactive Lesson

presentation/generate_pricing_lesson

book Instructions

This section will trigger the process to generate your Pricing Document. Generation can take up to 30 minutes depending on the number of products added.

  1. To enable this button, you must first have achieved a "Complete" status on the Offer Analysis Report section.

    2. Your Offer Analysis Report must be complete before moving on to this section.

  2. Click the Generate Pricing Document button.

    3. Click the Generate Pricing Document button.

  3. Your screen will change to read "Generation of Pricing Document is In Progress."

    4. Note the "In Progress" status.

  4. Generation of the document can take up to 30 minutes, but you can check the status at any time by clicking the Check Status button. You will need to refresh your screen by clicking this button until the status is Complete.

    5. Click the Refresh Status button until your status reads "Complete."

  5. Once your status reads "Complete," click the View Final Pricing Document link.

    6. Click the View Final Pricing Document link.

  6. A document will open that contains all of the information you have entered throughout the process.

    7. Open the Final Pricing Document.

  7. You may save a copy of this document for your records, or simply move on to Entering Your Standard Responses.

    8. Save a copy for your records.
